intro: Bondtia imbricata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. Bondtia imbricata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
